verses.text: And the word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out against the Philistines to battle , and pitched beside Eben-ezer : and the Philistines pitched in Aphek.\f + \fr 4.1 \ft came: or, came to pass: Heb. was\f*

And the Philistines put themselves in array against Israel : and when they joined battle , Israel was smitten before the Philistines : and they slew of the army in the field about four thousand men.\f + \fr 4.2 \ft they joined…: Heb. the battle was spread\f*\f + \fr 4.2 \ft army: Heb. array\f* \p

¶ And when the people were come into the camp , the elders of Israel said , Wherefore hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* smitten us to day before the Philistines ? Let us fetch the ark of the covenant of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* out of Shiloh unto us, that, when it cometh among us, it may save us out of the hand of our enemies.  +  r 4.3  t fetch: Heb. take unto us *

So the people sent to Shiloh , that they might bring from thence the ark of the covenant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , which dwelleth \add between\add* the cherubims : and the two sons of Eli , Hophni and Phinehas , \add were\add* there with the ark of the covenant of God.
And when the ark of the covenant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came into the camp , all Israel shouted with a great shout , so that the earth rang again.

And when the Philistines heard the noise of the shout , they said , What \add meaneth\add* the noise of this great shout in the camp of the Hebrews ? And they understood that the ark of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was come into the camp.

And the Philistines were afraid , for they said , God is come into the camp. And they said , Woe unto us! for there hath not been such a thing heretofore.\f + \fr 4.7 \ft heretofore: Heb. yesterday, or, the third day\f*
Woe unto us! who shall deliver us out of the hand of these mighty Gods ? these \add are\add* the Gods that smote the Egyptians with all the plagues in the wilderness.

Be strong , and quit yourselves like men , O ye Philistines , that ye be not servants unto the Hebrews , as they have been to you: quit yourselves like men , and fight.\f + \fr 4.9 \ft quit…: Heb. be men\f* \p
¶ And the Philistines fought , and Israel was smitten , and they fled every man into his tent : and there was a very great slaughter ; for there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen.
And the ark of God was taken ; and the two sons of Eli , Hophni and Phinehas , were slain.\f + \fr 4.11 \ft were slain: Heb. died\f* \p
¶ And there ran a man of Benjamin out of the army , and came to Shiloh the same day with his clothes rent , and with earth upon his head.
And when he came , lo, Eli sat upon a seat by the wayside watching : for his heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city , and told \add it\add*, all the city cried out.
And when Eli heard the noise of the crying , he said , What \add meaneth\add* the noise of this tumult ? And the man came in hastily , and told Eli.
Now Eli was ninety and eight years old ; and his eyes were dim , that he could not see.\f + \fr 4.15 \ft were dim: Heb. stood\f*
And the man said unto Eli , I \add am\add* he that came out of the army , and I fled to day out of the army. And he said , What is there done , my son ?\f + \fr 4.16 \ft is…: Heb. is the thing\f*

And the messenger answered and said , Israel is fled before the Philistines , and there hath been also a great slaughter among the people , and thy two sons also, Hophni and Phinehas , are dead , and the ark of God is taken.

And it came to pass, when he made mention of the ark of God , that he fell from off the seat backward by the side of the gate , and his neck brake , and he died : for he was an old man , and heavy. And he had judged Israel forty years. \p

¶ And his daughter in law , Phinehas’ wife , was with child , \add near\add* to be delivered : and when she heard the tidings that the ark of God was taken , and that her father in law and her husband were dead , she bowed herself and travailed ; for her pains came upon her.\f + \fr 4.19 \ft be delivered: or, cry out\f*\f + \fr 4.19 \ft came: Heb. were turned\f*

And about the time of her death the women that stood by her said unto her, Fear not; for thou hast born a son. But she answered not, neither did she regard \add it\add*.\f + \fr 4.20 \ft neither…: Heb. set not her heart\f*

And she named the child I-chabod , saying , The glory is departed from Israel : because the ark of God was taken , and because of her father in law and her husband.\f + \fr 4.21 \ft I-chabod: that is, Where is the glory? or, There is no glory\f*
And she said , The glory is departed from Israel : for the ark of God is taken.
